verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>,
Oh that <S%H3863><s%> my vexation <S%H3708><s%> were but <S%H8254><s%> weighed <S%H8254><s%>, And all my calamity <S%H1942><s%> laid <S%H5375><s%> in <S%H3162><s%> the balances <S%H3976><s%>!
For now it would be heavier <S%H3513><s%> than the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%>: Therefore have my words <S%H1697><s%> been rash <S%H3886><s%>.

For the arrows <S%H2671><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> are within <S%H5978><s%> me <S%H2534><s%>, The poison whereof my spirit <S%H7307><s%> drinketh up <S%H8354><s%>: The terrors <S%H1161><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> do set themselves in array against me <S%H6186><s%>.
Doth the wild ass <S%H6501><s%> bray <S%H5101><s%> when he hath grass <S%H1877><s%>? Or loweth <S%H1600><s%> the ox <S%H7794><s%> over his fodder <S%H1098><s%>?
Can that which hath no savor <S%H8602><s%> be eaten <S%H398><s%> without salt <S%H4417><s%>? Or is there <S%H3426><s%> any taste <S%H2940><s%> in the white <S%H7388><s%> of an egg <S%H2495><s%>?
My soul <S%H5315><s%> refuseth <S%H3985><s%> to touch <S%H5060><s%> them <S%H1741><s%>; They are as loathsome food to me <S%H3899><s%>.
Oh that I might have <S%H935><s%> my request <S%H7596><s%>; And that God <S%H433><s%> would grant <S%H5414><s%> me the thing that I long for <S%H8615><s%>!
Even that it would please <S%H2974><s%> God <S%H433><s%> to crush <S%H1792><s%> me <S%H5425><s%>; That he would let loose his hand <S%H3027><s%>, and cut me off <S%H1214><s%>!

And be it still my consolation <S%H5165><s%>, Yea <S%H5539><s%>, let me exult in pain <S%H2427><s%> that spareth <S%H2550><s%> not <S%H3582><s%>, That I have not denied the words <S%H561><s%> of the Holy One <S%H6918><s%>.
What is my strength <S%H3581><s%>, that I should wait <S%H3176><s%>? And what is mine end <S%H7093><s%>, that I should be <S%H5315><s%> patient <S%H748><s%>?
Is my strength <S%H3581><s%> the strength <S%H3581><s%> of stones <S%H68><s%>? Or is my flesh <S%H1320><s%> of brass <S%H5153><s%>?
Is it not that I have no help <S%H5833><s%> in me <S%H8454><s%>, And that wisdom is driven quite from me <S%H5080><s%>?

To him that is ready <S%H4523><s%> to faint kindness <S%H2617><s%> should be showed from his friend <S%H7453><s%>; Even to him that forsaketh <S%H5800><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>.
My brethren <S%H251><s%> have dealt deceitfully <S%H898><s%> as a brook <S%H5158><s%>, As the channel <S%H650><s%> of brooks <S%H5158><s%> that pass away <S%H5674><s%>;
Which are black <S%H6937><s%> by reason of the ice <S%H7140><s%>, And wherein the snow <S%H7950><s%> hideth itself <S%H5956><s%>:
What time <S%H6256><s%> they wax warm <S%H2215><s%>, they vanish <S%H6789><s%>; When it is hot <S%H2527><s%>, they are consumed out <S%H1846><s%> of their place <S%H4725><s%>.
The caravans <S%H734><s%> that travel by the way <S%H1870><s%> of them turn aside <S%H3943><s%>; They go <S%H5927><s%> up into the waste <S%H8414><s%>, and perish <S%H6><s%>.
The caravans <S%H734><s%> of Tema <S%H8485><s%> looked <S%H5027><s%>, The companies <S%H1979><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> waited for them <S%H6960><s%>.
They were put to shame <S%H954><s%> because they had hoped <S%H982><s%>; They came <S%H935><s%> thither <S%H2659><s%>, and were confounded.
For now ye are nothing <S%H7200><s%>; Ye see a terror <S%H2866><s%>, and are afraid <S%H3372><s%>.
Did I say <S%H559><s%>, Give <S%H3051><s%> unto me <S%H3051><s%>? Or, Offer a present for me of your substance <S%H3581><s%>?
Or <S%H4422><s%>, Deliver me from the adversary <S%H6862><s%>'s hand <S%H3027><s%>? Or <S%H6299><s%>, Redeem me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the oppressors <S%H6184><s%>?
Teach <S%H3384><s%> me <S%H2790><s%>, and I will hold my peace; And cause me to understand <S%H995><s%> wherein I have erred <S%H7686><s%>.
How forcible <S%H4834><s%> are words <S%H561><s%> of uprightness <S%H3476><s%>! But your reproof <S%H3198><s%>, what doth it reprove <S%H3198><s%>?
Do ye think <S%H2803><s%> to reprove <S%H3198><s%> words <S%H4405><s%>, Seeing that the speeches <S%H561><s%> of one that is desperate <S%H2976><s%> are as wind <S%H7307><s%>?
Yea <S%H5307><s%>, ye would cast lots upon the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, And make merchandise <S%H3738><s%> of your friend <S%H7453><s%>.
Now therefore be pleased <S%H2974><s%> to look <S%H6437><s%> upon me <S%H6440><s%>; For surely I shall not lie to your face <S%H3576><s%>.
Return <S%H7725><s%>, I pray you <S%H5766><s%>, let there be no injustice; Yea <S%H7725><s%>, return again, my cause is righteous <S%H6664><s%>.
Is there <S%H3426><s%> injustice <S%H5766><s%> on my tongue <S%H3956><s%>? Cannot my taste <S%H2441><s%> discern <S%H995><s%> mischievous things <S%H1942><s%>?
